alert.note: Alert for Eastern Clinton; Eastern Essex; Western Clinton (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 1:56AM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Clinton, central Franklin and northern Essex Counties through 245 AM EDT... At 156 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Debar Mountain, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Adirondack Regional Airport, Plattsburgh International Airport, Saranac Lake, Lake Placid, Plattsburgh, Peru, Schuyler Falls, Saranac, Wilmington, Keene, Wawbeek, Clayburg, Au Sable Forks, Debar Mountain, Peasleeville, Keeseville, Jay In Essex County, Madawaska, Dannemora and Harrietstown. This includes Interstate 87 between mile markers 120 and 154. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 AM EDT for northern New York.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Clinton; Eastern Essex; Western Clinton
